snippet.title: Simple, violent, addictive: Trials HD on Xbox 360
snippet.description: ...When a game is great, we refer to it as a "beer warmer." The genesis of this term? You sit down for an evening of gaming, open a beer, then find yourself so engrossed in the title that the next time you remember to take a sip, the beer's no longer cold. Microsoft has been releasing beer warmers with surprising regularity during this year's Summer of Arcade promotion, and the t...

snippet.title: Trials HD is great. It's a shame sharing tracks is broken
snippet.description: ...Trials HD ended up being one of the biggest surprises during this year's Summer of Arcade, bringing some addictive actionwith impressive graphicsto the Xbox Live Arcade. While I'm guessing many Xbox Live Arcade fans will jump over to Shadow Complex this Wednesday, Trials HD has the chance...

snippet.title: IFPI boss at TPB trial: you're either with us or against us
snippet.description: ...Since it began last week, the trial of the Pirate Bay in Sweden has truly been a "spectrial"and not just because of juvenile Pirate Bay antics such as last night's open letter to IFPI boss John Kennedy. The spectacle kicked back into high gear Wednesday as Kennedy traveled from London to Sweden to give testimony in the trial on behalf of the worldwide major-label music industry. On...

snippet.title: TPB trial witness: file-sharing not bad for music business
snippet.description: ...The Pirate Bay trial settled into something (sort of) approaching normality today as two professors took the stand. One explained more about how BitTorrent functions; the other got into a fight... from WallisThe Twitterati continue to translate the trial...

snippet.title: Trials HD dev: Xbox Live not ready for user-generated content
snippet.description: ...Trials HD is one of the better games released during this year's Summer of Arcade promotion on Xbox Live, but the game does have a major flaw: the user-created tracks can only be traded among friends, and only the creator can give the track to a friend. This effectively stops the spread...

snippet.title: Anti-"publication bias" efforts not panning out for science
snippet.description: ... to keep failed trials quiet. In 2005, medical journals forged a policy meant to ensure that a description of any clinical trial would be registered in public databases before it took place. A new study...: not every clinical study is being registered, and many trials result in publications that differ...
